section.title: DESCRIPTION
section.p: Lists all buckets in the cluster. Each bucket is printed to stdout on a separate line.

dd.p: Specfies the hostname of a node in the cluster. See the HOST FORMATS section for more information on specifying a hostname.
Specifies the username of the user executing the command. If you do not have a user account with permission to execute the command, the command fails with an unauthorized error.

Specifies the password of the user executing the command. If you do not have a user account with permission to execute the command, the commands with an unauthorized error. If this argument is specified, but no password is given, the command prompts the user for a password through non-echoed stdin. You may also specify your password with the environment variable CB_REST_PASSWORD.

section.title: ENVIRONMENT AND CONFIGURATION VARIABLES
section.p: CB_REST_PASSWORD Specifies the password of the user executing the command. This environment variable allows you to specify a default argument for the -p/--password argument on the command line. It also allows the user to ensure that their password is not cached in their command line history.
